en:
Interview with Linda Morrow, resident of Gatlinburg. Morrow discusses some history of Gatlinburg before recounting the night of the fire and being forced to evacuate her home on foot. Losing her home in the wildfire, she discusses the pain of the tragedy and the challenges faced in rebuilding.
 This is a representative quote from the interview: "We may be a tourist town, but we're a local community, who care deeply about each other. And we'll be there to help anyway possible--that I'm proud to be a part of."

Interview with Linda Morrow, 2019-10-14 -- Rocky Top Sports World
How long have you lived in Gatlinburg?
Can you tell us about your life here since moving here?
Can you talk about the differences between Gatlinburg when you arrived and now?
Can you talk about your home and where it was before the wildfires?
What do you remember about the days leading up to the wildfires?
What prompted you to leave your home that night?
Where were the rescue personnel taking you?
Can you describe the mood at Rocky Top that first night?
What day did your husband return?
Can you describe what it was like when you realized that you had lost everything?
Can you talk about the process of deciding to rebuild?
Is the lack of contractors due to high demand?
How do you feel the wildfires affected you looking back now?
How did the press affect your business?
Have you thought about any provisions going forward in case of a similar emergency?
Did you find anything surprising or good that came from this?
Is there anything else that you would like to add?
Rocky Top Sports World discussed in Interview with Linda Morrow, 2019-10-14

seo.title: Interview with Linda Morrow, 2019-10-14 - Rising From the Ashes Oral Histories
